page.title: 10 ** Hop Growing **
page.content: Throughout the growing season, workers are constantly{spraying}the hops to prevent diseases, moulds and weeds.{ { Hop_picking}lasts nearly all of September and many extra workers are needed on the farm, especially in the hop gardens, pulling down the hop{ {bines,}which are taken by tractor and trailer to the hop picking machine. There the hops are stripped off the bines, separated from the leaves and pass on a conveyor belt to the{oast {house,}where they are dried. The dried hops are then packed tightly into seven foot sacks, which are called{ {pockets.}The hop pockets are taken to a warehouse and are later distributed to brewers to be used for making{beer. Some of the oast houses around { {Lamberhurst}have been carefully converted into desirable residences.
